events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to involvement of the insured vehicle.
An agent was assigned to the case to oversee the investigation and assist the client through the process.
The customer received official acknowledgement of the claim ensuring their report has been recorded.
Request was sent for the police report, photos of the damage, and the vehicle registration paperwork.
The customer submitted all requested documentation including pictures and the official accident report.
Investigation began to verify the details of the collision and assess liability and damage extent.
The investigation concluded confirming the liable party and estimating repair costs for the vehicle.
A settlement offer was prepared and sent to the customer reflecting the evaluated damages and coverage.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the settlement amount proposed.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance company following the acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment was issued promptly to the customer to cover all approved repairs and damages caused by the accident.
The claim file was officially closed after payment confirmation and final customer satisfaction update.
The claim documents and case records were archived for future reference as per company protocol.
